oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rock House Holiness Church service, 1998 June 21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording opens with Lydia "Bugs" Hollins and two others leading a congregation of sixty-five in song. The service also features extended serpent handling and preaching by John Wayne "Punkin" Brown Jr., Billy Summerford, and Bill Pelfry. Several women congregants handle serpents, including Nola Faye Roberts, Lydia "Bugs" Hollins, and elderly twins. Joyce Summerford's singing is also featured.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Homecoming; Imposition of hands; Lay Preaching; Pentecostal preaching; Prayer; Singing -- Religious aspects; Slain in the Spirit; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern
Brown, John Wayne, Jr., 1964-1998; Brown, John, Sr.; Hollins, Lydia; Pelfry, Bill; Porter, Carl; Roberts, Nola Faye; Short, Gene; Summerford, Billy; Summerford, Joyce; Wade, James
Rock House Holiness Church (Sand Mountain, Ala.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Rock House Holiness Church field recordings, 1996-2004
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
